root_causes: Does not enforce the required entry condition IsInProductionMode() — the check is only shown as a commented example rather than applied
Uses placeholder ProdModeVar instead of the actual project production-flag variable (no concrete scoping implemented)
No executable SPSS check is provided — script is descriptive rather than implementing the production-scoped validation
instructions:
Scope the validation to production respondents per the expected entry condition. Replace ProdModeVar with the actual production-flag variable (or use the project's IsInProductionMode wrapper) and make the SELECT IF actionable. Example SPSS lines to implement:
TEMPORARY.
SELECT IF (ProdModeVar = 1) & (MISS(qList) OR ~RANGE(qList,1,2)).
LIST respid qList.
Replace ProdModeVar with the real variable name (or, if available, use SELECT IF IsInProductionMode() & (MISS(qList) OR ~RANGE(qList,1,2))).

If there truly is no production-flag variable available, explicitly run the structural check for all cases (but document this exception). Example:
TEMPORARY.
SELECT IF (MISS(qList) OR ~RANGE(qList,1,2)).
LIST respid qList.
Do not add or accept unconfirmed special codes (97/98/99). Only allow answer codes 1 and 2 per the specification.
Ensure the final script contains executable SPSS statements (TEMPORARY/SELECT IF/LIST) rather than only commented guidance so the validation is actually performed.
Retry with reduced context or smaller batch size
Retry with reduced context or smaller batch size
